bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 195 (Tuesday, December 11, 2018)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. POLIQUIN:H.R. 7257.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:``Article I, Section 8 of the United States Constitutionwhich enumerates the power of Congress: To coin Money,regulate the Value thereof, and of foreign Coin, and fix theStandard of Weights and Measures;''
[Page H10103]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

item.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

item.text:
President George H. W. Bush and Barbara Bush Dollar Coin Act

This bill requires the issuance of

  • $1 coins bearing the image of President George H.W. Bush for a one-year period beginning on January 1, 2019, and
  • bullion coins bearing the image of Barbara Bush during that same period.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: President George H. W. Bush and Barbara Bush Dollar Coin Act

item.title: To amend title 31, United States Code, to require $1 coins issued during 2019 to honor President George H. W. Bush and to direct the Secretary of the Treasury to issue bullion coins during 2019 in honor of Barbara Bush.
President George H. W. Bush and Barbara Bush Dollar Coin Act
President George H. W. Bush and Barbara Bush Dollar Coin Act

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
